column7: Arable fields and waste places, especially on chalky soils[17].
column16: Caucalis platycarpos is a ANNUAL growing to 0.3 m (1ft).  It is in flower from June to July. The species is hermaphrodite (has both male and female organs) and is pollinated by Insects. The plant is self-fertile.  Suitable for: light (sandy), medium (loamy) and heavy (clay) soils. Suitable pH: mildly acid, neutral and basic (mildly alkaline) soils and can grow in very alkaline soils. It cannot grow in the shade. It prefers  moist soil.
column17: C. daucoides. L. 1767, non L. 1753. C. lappula.
column21: Leaves - raw or cooked[105, 177]. The leaves have been used as a pot-herb and have also been pickled for use in winter salads[2].
